result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dettrick Lamar Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Dettrick Lamar Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Dettrick Lamar Brown.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and global offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown in court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 17CF371. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Holsen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with KMT DOB: 9/5/1988
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Dettrick Lamar Brown in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dettrick Lamar Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
